titles.title: Aircraft Repair Station Security Enhancement Act of 2005
To amend title 49, United States Code, to require employment investigations for employees of aircraft repair stations, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Aviation.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary: 12/16/2005--Introduced. Aircraft Repair Station Security Enhancement Act of 2005 - Amends federal transportation law to direct the Under Secretary of Transportation for Security to require by regulation that an employment investigation (including a criminal history record check and a review of available law enforcement data bases and records of other governmental and international agencies) be conducted by repair station operators of repair station employees (including current employees) who perform maintenance on aircraft or aircraft components (or both) at domestic or certificated foreign repair stations.
